curam.util.events.impl
Class EventService

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.events.impl.EventService

public final class EventService
extends java.lang.Object

EventService is an API for creating events that drive the Curam event infrastructure.

This class enables an application to make use of the observer pattern, where one area of the application (the observer) can register interest in an event raised by another area of the application (the observed). It can therefore be used in situations where an application requires a means of associating otherwise independent activities. The link between the two is an event handler. An event handler interface provides an implementation space for a user-defined handler. See EventHandler for more details. Event filters can be associated with the event handler to determine whether or not the handler is invoked. See EventFilter for more details.

When an event is raised, the event service checks to see if there is a filter registered for the event class. If an event filter is registered for the event and if the filter determines that an event handler should be invoked, the event service checks to see if there is a handler registered for the event class. If there is, the event handler is invoked to process the event.

The basic mechanism of event handling is as follows: the application raises an event of a particular class. The event service invokes the event filter and event handler for that event class. This assumes the event class has been registered against the appropriate filter and handler and that the event match engine is aware of both the filter and the handler through the relevant application properties. An event contains 

 
  •  an event class - a named functional area of an application, e.g.
 Case.
 
  •  an event type - a named source of events associated with a biz object
 type, e.g. CaseOpen.
 
  •  event match data - this can be any numeric value relevant to the
 process of event matching, e.g. Case ID.
 
  •  event output mapping data - this can be any numeric value and is
 intended for events that must represent an association between two entities.
 
  •  the raised by user - the name of the user that raised the event.

    • The event class is by convention in Curam a functional area of an application with one or more event types defined as event sources. For example, an event class of "Case" might be associated with three different event types: SubmitCase, CloseCase, OpenCase. Each event class/event type pairing: Case/SubmitCase, Case/CloseCase, Case/OpenCase plus the corresponding event data define an event.

    Method Detail

    raiseEvent

    public static void raiseEvent(Event event)
                       throws AppException,
                              InformationalException
    Used to raise an event. When an event is raised, the event system becomes aware that some noteworthy task has completed which in turn triggers a call to the appropriate event handler.

    Parameters:
    event - the event to raise.
    Throws:
    AppException - exceptions that may be thrown when invoking the optional filter and handler associated with the event being raised.
    InformationalException - An exception that contains all the exceptions thrown by any of the invoked handlers.
